questiontext.text: In a class of 36 students, there is a pass rate of 0.8 in a given exam. Calculate the probability that at least 31 students pass the exam. Give your answer as a probabilty between 0 and 1, and give it to three significant figures.

generalfeedback.text: Because it is at least in the question, we need to use 31 - 1, and lower.tail = FALSE. So use pbinom(q = 30, size = 36, prob = 0.8, lower.tail = F).

questiontext.text: In a class of 28 students, there is a pass rate of 0.8 in a given exam. Calculate the probability that at least 23 students pass the exam. Give your answer as a probabilty between 0 and 1, and give it to three significant figures.

generalfeedback.text: Because it is at least in the question, we need to use 23 - 1, and lower.tail = FALSE. So use pbinom(q = 22, size = 28, prob = 0.8, lower.tail = F).

generalfeedback.text: Because it is at least in the question, we need to use 24 - 1, and lower.tail = FALSE. So use pbinom(q = 23, size = 29, prob = 0.8, lower.tail = F).

questiontext.text:
Load up the tidyverse package, and examine the airquality dataset therein. This contains daily air quality measurements in New York, May to September 1973. For the month of September, calculate the 95% confidence interval for the mean of the Wind Speed in mph using a t test.

95% Bounds Confidence Interval for Mean
Lower Interval {1:NUMERICAL:=8.888:0.05~%0%708681:0}
Higher Interval {1:NUMERICAL:=11.47:0.05~%0%708681:0}

generalfeedback.text: Use margin <- qt(0.975, df=n-1)*s/sqrt(n), then xbar + c(-margin, +margin) where xbar is the mean, n is the number of samples,and s is the sample standard deviation.

questiontext.text: Soil samples from a coastal area have a mean pH value of 7.8 with a standard deviation of 2.15. Calculate the probability that a given soil sample will have a pH value between 7.2 and 7.95.

generalfeedback.text: The command pnorm(7.95, 7.8, 2.15) will give the probability of a sample being less than 7.95. The command pnorm(7.2, 7.8, 2.15) will give the probability of a sample being less than 7.2. The difference will give answer needed.

questiontext.text: Soil samples from a coastal area have a mean pH value of 9.48 with a standard deviation of 1. Calculate the probability that a given soil sample will have a pH value between 7.5 and 10.

generalfeedback.text: The command pnorm(10, 9.48, 1) will give the probability of a sample being less than 10. The command pnorm(7.5, 9.48, 1) will give the probability of a sample being less than 7.5. The difference will give answer needed.

questiontext.text: Soil samples from a coastal area have a mean pH value of 6.98 with a standard deviation of 2.77. Calculate the probability that a given soil sample will have a pH value between 6.45 and 7.96.

generalfeedback.text: The command pnorm(7.96, 6.98, 2.77) will give the probability of a sample being less than 7.96. The command pnorm(6.45, 6.98, 2.77) will give the probability of a sample being less than 6.45. The difference will give answer needed.
